value.0: Greetings, traveller. I see you have also found the source of the local petrification problems.

I am Ferdinand, I offer my services to track down and procure magical beasts for those who compensate well for the difficulty and danger of such tasks. This fine specimen here is no exception to that.

As someone who always loved handling animals, I ended up tending magical beasts for the Neverwinter Academy some time ago. But then I too felt the pull of adventure and decided to leave to travel myself, and apparently picked a good time to get out of the city.
Ordinarily, it would be. A lifetime's experience of taming rare and exotic beasts has its advantages, however.
Unfortunately, I cannot leave without this cockatrice fully intact, else my client would not be pleased.
I offer my services to track down and procure magical beasts for those who compensate well for the difficulty and danger of such tasks. This fine specimen here is no exception to that.
Farewell, stranger.
Actually, now that you mention it... perhaps, though it would not be easy to get what I seek.

I would need you to find and capture an adult gorgon and basilisk, so that I might have alternatives to offer my client. I would give you the means to capture them, but you would have to track them down yourself.
Farewell, stranger. You know where to find me if you change your mind.
Take this orb, then; it should be able to trap and capture an adult basilisk and an adult gorgon. Once this is done, bring it back to me, and I will be able to release them and tame them.
Basilisks tend to live in rockier landscapes further inland, such as that found to the east of here. I would suggest you search for a basilisk there.

As for the gorgon, I have heard rumours of some somewhere along the coast to the south of here, but I have not been able to confirm that. Gorgons generally keep to themselves, but will fiercely defend their home. I imagine the locals would assume all the petrifications around the High Road have come from the same place, but that isn't necessarily true.
I wish you luck, traveller. I would prefer not to find you petrified on my travels.
Ask, and I will answer, if I can.
Hello again, traveller.
Excellent work! Here are the feathers you sought.
I should be going now.
Who are you?
How did you get into this line of work?
Isn't that cockatrice dangerous?
I have come here in search of the cockatrice's feathers, which are needed for a cure for the Wailing Death.
Your client?
I'm here to take the cockatrice feathers, whether you like it or not! <StartAction>[Attack]</Start>
Very well, I shall have to look for another elsewhere.
Is there anything I could trade you for its feathers?
Forget it, I'd rather take the feathers by force than do that! <StartAction>[Attack]
Forget it. I'll find another cockatrice elsewhere.
Very well, if that is how it must be.
I shall begin my hunt.
I have other questions.
I'm here to take the cockatrice feathers, whether you like it or not! <StartAction>[Attack]</Start>
I have captured the gorgon and basilisk.
